action.action-desc: Mr. Meeks introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 to prohibit the flying of unmanned recreational aircraft near commercial airports.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Responsible Skies Act of 2015.

section.header: Prohibition on the flying of unmanned recreational aircraft near commercial airports
section.text: Section 333 of the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 (49 U.S.C. 40101 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c) by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and

quoted-block.text: , including that the operator of an unmanned recreational aircraft may not fly the aircraft—

subsection.text: above 400 feet and within 5 miles of the perimeter of an airport that provides scheduled passenger air transportation; or
where it may be seem from the perimeter of the airport.

paragraph.text: by inserting at the end the following:

subsection.text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, and every year thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report containing—

paragraph.text: a description of any incident in which an unmanned recreational aircraft flew above 400 feet less than 5 miles from the perimeter of an airport that provides scheduled passenger air transportation; and
the action taken by the Secretary in response to the incident.

subsection.text: In this section, the term unmanned recreational aircraft means an unmanned aircraft flown for hobby or recreational purposes.
